title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Stabilization of Iraq
summary: The document titled "Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Stabilization of Iraq" outlines the decision to extend a national emergency initially declared by Executive Order 13303 on May 22, 2003. The President cites ongoing threats to U.S. national security and foreign policy stemming from challenges in Iraq, including the reconstruction efforts, peace maintenance, and the establishment of political and economic institutions. The national emergency will continue for another year, as mandated by the National Emergencies Act. This notice is to be published in the Federal Register and communicated to Congress, reflecting the sustained U.S. commitment to addressing the complexities in Iraq.
